title: Where can I, as an individual, find clean programs to analyze?
content:
This question includes a good list of sources where an individual might collect malware samples for analysis.

I'd like to get a large number of public, non-malicious programs for the purpose of comparing various attributes to malware samples. 

I have explored the following options:

I suppose what would be ideal for my situation is a sort of program dump, but I'm not aware of any that exist.

As someone unaffiliated with any organisation, is there an effective way of getting a large number of public normal programs for the purpose of comparing their features to a set of malicious programs?

comments.text: Possible duplicate of Where can I find benign samples with a high potential to false positive?
If you are not limited by using Windows as a base OS, you have a lot of pre-compiled programs in Ubuntu and other Linux related repositories, for example here: packages.ubuntu.com.
@Nordwald it's also a duplicate of a question that wasn't closed as off-topic, with more helpful answers. see my comment.
@Nirlzr Regardless, the closed topic may be more strongly related. The reasoning behind this decision may apply here as well.
